intro: Jussiaea repens var. flaviflora, commonly known as the yellow-flowered jussiaea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in wet, marshy areas and is adapted to moist, nutrient-poor soils. Its leaves are opposite and oval-shaped, while the flowers are usually clustered in small inflorescences. It plays a role in wetland ecosystems by stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
